data.text:
Softcover. First edition, “La Librairie des Editions de Minuit (sur Bouffant)” issue, limited to 92 numbered copies, this copy is number 87. 12mo. White printed wrappers. Spine is lightly toned with tiny nick at head of spine, else a fine unopened copy in publisher’s unprinted good or better wrap-around glassine wrapper. The wrapper is lightly tanned with a few small closed tears and a chip on the fold over the fore-edge. Publisher’s numbered slip laid into the book matching the limitation number on verso of title page. The French novelist Claude Simon, often identified with the nouveau roman movement, won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1985.

Item #498947
